analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la gnas pas gnas pa la ni /

analyzed: lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin du bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis bdag cag gis 'di bzung la mtho btsam mo //

analyzed: snyam pa dang / bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las slar bzlog par bya'o // snyam pa'i glags @405b rnyed par mi 'gyur /

original: gting rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gting rnyed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: They will not find an opportunity, they will not find a point of entry.

original: rab 'byor / de lta bas na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / de lta bas na /
translated: Subhūti, therefore

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: Similarly, they complete the cultivation of the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, and the perfection of concentration.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa drug po thams cad bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa ni / pha rol tu phyin pa drug po thams cad bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Subhūti, bodhisattva-mahāsattvas practicing the perfection of wisdom🔽complete the cultivation of all six perfections.

analyzed: thabs mkhas pa thams cad bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur te /
translated: They complete the cultivation of all skillful means.

analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pa des ni /
translated: The bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices the perfection of wisdom

analyzed: bdud kyi las gang cung zad 'byung bar 'gyur ba de dag thams cad 'byung ba'i tshe rab tu shes par 'gyur te /

analyzed: rab tu shes nas rnam par spong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: having known them, will abandon them.🔽Subhūti, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who wish to take up all skillful means

analyzed: rab 'byor / thabs mkhas pa thams cad yongs su gzung bar 'dod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyad @406a *//

translated: They should cultivate the perfection of wisdom.

original: rab 'byor / gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe rab 'byor /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod cing shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub par byed pa de'i tshe rab 'byor /
translated: Subhūti, when bodhisattva mahāsattvas practice the perfection of wisdom and accomplish the perfection of wisdom, at that time, Subhūti,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'jig rten gyi khams gzhal du med grangs med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes pa de dag la de dag gi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos 'jig rten gyi khams gzhal du med grangs med pa dag na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag bzhugs te 'tsho zhing gzhes pa de dag la de dag gi thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyang 'di lta ste /
translated: Bodhisattva great beings should know that the omniscience of the blessed buddhas who dwell, live, and abide in the countless, immeasurable world systems is as follows.🔽

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las skyes so; ;snyam du bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di las skyes so; ;snyam du bsam par bya'o //
translated: “Bodhisattva great beings should think, ‘The omniscience of those lord buddhas who are present, alive, and well in countless, innumerable world systems comes from this—namely, the perfection of wisdom.’

original: de ltar bsams nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des kyang sems 'di ltar bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar bsams nas byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po des kyang sems 'di ltar bskyed par bya ste /
translated: “Having thought in that way, that bodhisattva great being should also think, ‘I too should give rise to this thought:

original: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang dag rjes su brnyes pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang chos de dag rjes su thob par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis chos gang dag rjes su brnyes pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang chos de dag rjes su thob par bya'o //
translated: Just as those lord buddhas have attained those dharmas, so too I will attain those dharmas.’

original: snyam ste / rab 'byor /
analyzed: snyam ste / rab 'byor /
translated: “Subhūti,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas nyin gcig 'das kyi bar la tha na se gol gtogs pa srid tsam du yang sems bskyed pa 'di dag bskyed par bya /
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod pas nyin gcig 'das kyi bar la tha na se gol gtogs pa srid tsam du yang sems bskyed pa 'di dag bskyed par bya /
translated: Thus, a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom should generate these thoughts even for the duration of a finger snap.

original: mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: Thus, Subhūti, a bodhisattva great being practicing the perfection of wisdom should, even for a single day, generate these thoughts and accomplish them, even for the duration of a finger snap.

original: rab 'byor / gang yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du sbyin pa byin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' @406b sems dpa' chen po dmigs pa can de bas ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gang yang dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du sbyin pa byin pa'i byang chub sems dpa' @406b sems dpa' chen po dmigs pa can de bas ni /
translated: Subhūti, compared to a bodhisattva great being with reference points who gives gifts for eons equal to the sands of the Ganges river,

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis nyi ma gcig 'das kyi bar la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chung ngu na se gol gtogs pa gcig tsam du mngon par sgrub na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis nyi ma gcig 'das kyi bar la shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di chung ngu na se gol gtogs pa gcig tsam du mngon par sgrub na /
translated: a bodhisattva great being who accomplishes this perfection of wisdom, even for a single day, even for the duration of a finger snap,

original: bsod nams ches mang du bskyed de /
analyzed: bsod nams ches mang du bskyed de /
translated: generates much more merit.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po 'di ni /
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva will stand on the irreversible bhūmi.

original: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog pa'i sa la gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: This bodhisattva mahāsattva will stand on the irreversible bhūmi.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang nyin gcig 'das kyi bar la chung ngu na se gol gtogs pa srid tsam yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod cing sems bskyed pa 'di bskyed pa de; de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs par rig
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang nyin gcig 'das kyi bar la chung ngu na se gol gtogs pa srid tsam yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'di la spyod cing sems bskyed pa 'di bskyed pa de; de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs par rig
translated: “Subhūti, if a bodhisattva mahāsattva who practices this perfection of wisdom for even the length of time it takes to snap one’s fingers, or even for a mere instant, should arouse this thought, then the Tathāgata would know him,

original: par bya na /
analyzed: par bya na /
translated: would see him, and would be aware of him.

original: gang sems bskyed pa 'di nyin thog thag rjes su 'jug par byed pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang sems bskyed pa 'di nyin thog thag rjes su 'jug par byed pa lta ci smos /
translated: What need is there to mention those who follow this thought throughout the day?

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs pas 'gro ba gang zhig la re bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs pas 'gro ba gang zhig la re bar bya zhe na /
translated: “Subhūti, if the Tathāgata were to know, see, and be aware of a bodhisattva mahāsattva who is known by the Tathāgata, what would he be known for?

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs pas ni /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de bzhin gshegs pas dgongs pas ni /
translated: Subhūti, a bodhisattva mahāsattva who is known by the Tathāgata would be known for the great compassion.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma gtogs par 'gro ba gzhan du dogs par mi bya ste /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ma gtogs par 'gro ba gzhan du dogs par mi bya ste /
translated: They should not fear any other destiny than unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ni / skal ba med pa dang / ngan song rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ni / skal ba med pa dang / ngan song rnams su skye bar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: They will not be born in unfortunate or lower realms.

original: mtho ris su skye bar re bar bya'o; ;der yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: mtho ris su skye bar re bar bya'o; ;der yang de bzhin gshegs pa rnams dang mi 'bral bar 'gyur zhing /
translated: They should hope to be born in the higher realms, and there they will not be separated from the tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dang ma bral ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye bar 'gyur te /🔽sems can yongs su smin @407a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dang ma bral ba'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du skye bar 'gyur te / sems can yongs su smin @407a *//
translated: They will be born in buddhafields where they will not be separated from the tathāgatas.

original: par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will bring beings to maturity.

original: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis chung ngu na se gol gtogs pa gcig tsam du'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
analyzed: rab 'byor / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po gang gis chung ngu na se gol gtogs pa gcig tsam du'ang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la spyod de /
translated: “Subhūti, if bodhisattva great beings practice the perfection of wisdom, even for as little as the time it takes to snap one’s fingers,

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub cing sems bskyed pa 'di skyed par byed pa'i yon tan 'di dag dang / phan yon 'di dag yin na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa mngon par sgrub cing sems bskyed pa 'di skyed par byed pa'i yon tan 'di dag dang / phan yon 'di dag yin na /
translated: and if they produce this thought of generating the perfection of wisdom and accomplish it, they will have these good qualities and these benefits.

original: gang zhig sems bskyed pa 'di nyin thog thag rjes su 'jug par byed pa lta ci smos /
analyzed: gang zhig sems bskyed pa 'di nyin thog thag rjes su 'jug par byed pa lta ci smos /
translated: how much more so if they follow it day after day!

original: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / 'di lta ste /
translated: Subhūti, it is like this:

original: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi bskyod pa'i drung na da ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spos kyi glang po zhes bya ba tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na / de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas mi bskyod pa'i drung na da ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po spos kyi glang po zhes bya ba tshangs par spyad pa spyod pa bzhin no //
translated: for example, just as the bodhisattva mahāsattva named Gandhahastin, who practices pure conduct in the presence of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One Akṣobhya.

original: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa las /🔽me tog bkram pa'i le'u zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa brgyad stong pa las / me tog bkram pa'i le'u zhes bya ste /
translated: In the Noble Perfection of Wisdom in Eight Thousand Lines,

original: nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'o ////
analyzed: nyi shu rtsa brgyad pa'o ////
translated: the chapter called Scattering Flowers is the twenty-eighth.

original: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'di ltar rjes su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rab 'byor / gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen pos shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la 'di ltar rjes su rig par bya ste /
translated: Furthermore, Subhūti, the bodhisattva mahāsattva should understand the perfection of wisdom as follows:

original: chos thams cad chags pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad chags pa med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the perfection of wisdom because all phenomena are free from attachment.

original: chos thams cad dbyer mi phyed pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad dbyer mi phyed pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the perfection of wisdom as the indivisibility of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'byung ba med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the perfection of wisdom as the non-arising of all phenomena.

original: chos thams cad 'gyur ba med @407b par mnyam pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'gyur ba med @407b par mnyam pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the perfection of wisdom as the sameness of all phenomena in being unchanging.

original: chos thams cad bdag med pa dang rnam par rig pa med par shes rab kyis rjes su rtogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad bdag med pa dang rnam par rig pa med par shes rab kyis rjes su rtogs pas shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the perfection of wisdom as the realization by wisdom of all phenomena as selfless and without awareness.

original: chos thams cad ming tsam dang tha snyad gdags pa tsam gyis brjod pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad ming tsam dang tha snyad gdags pa tsam gyis brjod pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand the perfection of wisdom as the expression of all phenomena merely as names and mere conventional designations.

original: tha snyad gdags pa'ang gang la yang ma yin /
analyzed: tha snyad gdags pa'ang gang la yang ma yin /
translated: Conventional designations do not exist anywhere,

original: gang gis kyang ma yin /
analyzed: gang gis kyang ma yin /
translated: they do not exist in anything,

original: gang yang tha snyad gdags pa med do //
analyzed: gang yang tha snyad gdags pa med do //
translated: and there are no conventional designations at all.

original: chos thams cad tha snyad med pa /
analyzed: chos thams cad tha snyad med pa /
translated: Because all phenomena are without conventional expressions,

original: brjod du med pa /
analyzed: brjod du med pa /
translated: inexpressible,

original: smrar med pa /
analyzed: smrar med pa /
translated: unutterable,

original: tshig med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshig med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: and without words, one should understand them to be the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos thams cad tshad ma med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad tshad ma med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: Because all phenomena are immeasurable, one should understand them to be the perfection of wisdom.

original: gzugs tshad ma med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs tshad ma med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: Because form is immeasurable, one should understand it to be the perfection of wisdom.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba tshad ma med pa dang / 'du shes tshad ma med pa dang / 'du byed rnams tshad ma med pa dang / rnam par shes pa tshad ma med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba tshad ma med pa dang / 'du shes tshad ma med pa dang / 'du byed rnams tshad ma med pa dang / rnam par shes pa tshad ma med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, because feeling is immeasurable, perception is immeasurable, volitional factors are immeasurable, and consciousness is immeasurable, one should understand them to be the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mtshan ma med pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: Because all phenomena are signless, one should understand them to be the perfection of wisdom.

original: chos thams cad nges par 'byed pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad nges par 'byed pa'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin par rjes su rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that it is the perfection of wisdom because it is the certain deliverance of all dharmas.
